column4: hello, a question about user and group. As user, my id is let's say "me', and I belong to group "me". I would like me to belong, not to the "me" group, but to the "users" group? Is it possible ? Do you if it could break something ? Thanks.
use "usermod -G -a <name of group>" but read the man page for usermod first ;-)
in short, you can be in many groups at once
wols : is it useful to belong to more than one group ?
ok, I'm gonna subscribe "me" to the "users" group first. You told me to read the usermod man pages, I saw there is a GUI for that. I suppose it is secure enuf ?
just that there are some implications to using usermod -G
-a adds a group, leaving out -a replaces the groups with the list you give it
if you're not careful you can take yourself out of the admin group

where <username> is whatever your real username is

the right command is : "usermod -G users -a me" - "usermod -G -a me" gave me an error
